main.docTitle: Waste Disposal (Designated Waste Disposal Facility) Regulation

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: authorized officer (獲授權人員) has the same meaning as in section 2(1) of the Ordinance;

construction waste (建築廢物) and inert construction waste (惰性建築廢物) have the same meaning as in section 2 of the Waste Disposal (Charges for Disposal of Construction Waste) Regulation (Cap. 354 sub. leg. N); (L.N. 165 of 2004)
designated officer (指定人員) means any person appointed by the Director under section 3;
designated waste disposal facility (指定廢物處置設施) means any premises specified in column 2 of Schedule 1; (L.N. 165 of 2004)
facility operator (設施經營人) means any person who has entered into an agreement with the Government for the operation or management of a designated waste disposal facility;
relevant activity (有關活動) means the collection, removal, transportation, transfer, reception or disposal (including treatment, reprocessing or recycling) of waste.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Regulation, the boundaries of a designated waste disposal facility shall be deemed to be those delineated in the drawing or plan specified in column 4 of Schedule 1 opposite the name of the facility in column 2 of that Schedule and held by the Director. (L.N. 165 of 2004)

The Director may in writing appoint any public officer, any person employed by a facility operator, any contractor (other than a facility operator) or any person employed by such contractor to be a designated officer for the purposes of this Regulation.

subsection.def: In this section contractor (other than a facility operator) (承辦商(設施經營人除外)) means any person, other than a facility operator, who has entered into an agreement with the Government or with any facility operator for the carrying out of any activity or the provision of any service in connection with the operation or management of a designated waste disposal facility.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to the provisions in the Waste Disposal (Charges for Disposal of Construction Waste) Regulation (Cap. 354 sub. leg. N), construction waste may be accepted for disposal at a designated waste disposal facility only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the facility is one specified in column 2 of Schedule 2; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the construction waste falls within the type specified in column 3 of that Schedule opposite that facility.

subsection.content: No waste shall be accepted for disposal at a designated waste disposal facility specified in item 1(b), 3 or 4 in column 2 of Schedule 2 unless it is construction waste that falls within the type specified in column 3 of that Schedule opposite that facility. (L.N. 188 of 2013)

The Director shall give notice in the Gazette of the criteria adopted from time to time to determine, for the purposes of subsections (1) and (2), whether any waste falls within a type of construction waste specified in column 3 of Schedule 2. (L.N. 3 of 2005)
A notice under subsection (3) is not subsidiary legislation. (L.N. 3 of 2005)

section.name: s3AB
section.heading: Designated waste disposal facility must not accept e-waste
section.content: A person must not accept for disposal any e-waste at any designated waste disposal facility.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a vehicle equipped with devices specifically designed for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: loading household waste or trade waste (or both); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: compacting household waste or trade waste (or both).

subsection.def: If a person drives the vehicle into any of the designated waste disposal facilities specified in items 1, 2, 3 and 5 to 18 in column 2 of Schedule 1 (specified facility), the vehicle must conform with the requirement in subsection (3).

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the vehicle must be equipped with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a metal tailgate cover; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a waste water sump tank;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the construction of the cover and the tank must be suitable for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: ensuring safety to all persons present at the specified facility;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: avoiding any nuisance, or any danger to health or the environment, arising from any activity in the specified facility; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: preventing disruption to the operation of the specified facility, or any relevant activity in the specified facility; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the cover and the tank must be in good working condition.

subsection.leadIn: If subsection (2) is contravened, the following person commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (if the driver of the vehicle drives the vehicle into the specified facility on the instructions of the driver’s employer) the employer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (in any other case) the driver of the vehicle. (L.N. 188 of 2013 and L.N. 13 of 2014)

subsection.content: It is a defence for a person charged under subsection (4) to prove that the person took all reasonable precautions and exercised all due diligence to avoid the commission of the offence. (L.N. 188 of 2013 and L.N. 13 of 2014)

subsection.leadIn: The Director may, for the purpose of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: regulating traffic within, entering or leaving any designated waste disposal facility;

paragraph.name: b
c
d
e
paragraph.content: preventing or deterring the commission of any offence against the Ordinance in or in relation to any designated waste disposal facility;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: detecting the commission of any offence against the Ordinance in or in relation to any designated waste disposal facility; or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: deterring the evasion of charges payable under the Ordinance by any person in connection with any relevant activity in any designated waste disposal facility,

subsection.continued: exercise any of the powers specified in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The powers specified for the purpose of subsection (1) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the power to order or signal the driver of a vehicle within or entering or leaving a designated waste disposal facility—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to stop the vehicle immediately;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to proceed to any place or to park the vehicle at any location within the facility; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: to leave the facility;

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.leadIn: the power to order or signal the master of a vessel within or entering or leaving a designated waste disposal facility—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to stop the vessel immediately;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to move the vessel to or moor it at any place within the facility; or

subparagraph.name: iii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if there are reasonable grounds for believing it to be necessary for any purpose specified in subsection (1), the power—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: to require the driver of a vehicle within a designated waste disposal facility or stopped by the Director under paragraph (a)— (L.N. 165 of 2004)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: to produce his driving licence for examination;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to give the name and address of the registered owner of the vehicle;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: to provide such information as is within the driver’s knowledge concerning waste being carried on the vehicle;

subparagraph.name: ia
subparagraph.leadIn: to require the master of a vessel within a designated waste disposal facility or stopped by the Director under paragraph (aa)—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: to produce the licence issued by the Director of Marine in respect of the vessel under section 15 or 19 of the Merchant Shipping (Local Vessels) (Certification and Licensing) Regulation (Cap. 548 sub. leg. D) for examination; (24 of 2005 s. 55)

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to give the name and address of the registered owner of the vessel;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: to provide such information as is within the master’s knowledge concerning the waste being carried on the vessel; (L.N. 165 of 2004)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to enter, examine and search the vehicle referred to in subparagraph (i) or the vessel referred to in subparagraph (ia) and any thing in or on that vehicle or vessel, and to take from it and retain samples of any materials having the appearance of waste; (L.N. 165 of 2004)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: to require any person found in or on that vehicle or vessel to give his name and address and to produce any document in his possession which is or contains evidence of his name and address; (L.N. 165 of 2004)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where any vehicle, vessel or thing is causing disruption to the operation of any designated waste disposal facility or is otherwise likely to render the use of the facility unsafe, the power to take all reasonable steps, at the owner’s expense, to remove the vehicle, vessel or thing or cause it to be removed to any place, including any road, that the Director may think fit and where necessary in the opinion of the Director, to provide for its safe custody; (L.N. 165 of 2004)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: where any person has failed to pay any charge under the Ordinance in full as required in any invoice, demand note, bill or the like issued by the Director or any person appointed by the Director to collect such charge, but subject to subsection (3), the power to suspend the provision to that person of the services provided at any designated waste disposal facility; and (L.N. 188 of 2013)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the power to examine a vehicle within or entering or leaving a designated waste disposal facility to check whether the vehicle meets the requirements in this Regulation. (L.N. 188 of 2013)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: A driver who is required under subsection (2)(b)(i)(A) to produce his or her driving licence is to be regarded as having complied with the requirement if the driver produces his or her electronic driving licence to the Director. (26 of 2025 s. 16)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2A), a driver is to be regarded as having not produced his or her electronic driving licence if—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: the driver fails to comply with a reasonable request by the Director to facilitate the reading or scanning of the licence. (26 of 2025 s. 16)

subsection.leadIn: The power conferred under subsection (2)(d) shall not be exercised in a particular case unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice issued by the Director for the purposes of this subsection specifying a period within which the charge shall be paid has been served on the person personally or by post; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person has failed to pay the charge or any part of the charge within the period so specified.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may in writing authorize—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: any facility operator to exercise the powers and perform the duties conferred or imposed on the Director under subsection (2)(c), (d) or (e). (L.N. 188 of 2013)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.leadIn: The Director or an authorized officer may also exercise the following powers—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: refuse to accept any waste at a designated waste disposal facility in such circumstances as the Director thinks fit;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (4B), require any person who delivers any waste to a designated waste disposal facility to state the nature of the waste and give such other information as the Director considers necessary to determine whether or not to accept the waste at that facility;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: close temporarily a designated waste disposal facility or any part of it for such period as the Director considers necessary by posting a notice of closure in such conspicuous places in the facility as the Director may determine. (L.N. 165 of 2004; L.N. 3 of 2005)

subsection.name: 4B
subsection.content: If a person delivering any waste to a designated waste disposal facility informs the Director that the waste is construction waste, the Director shall not require the person to state whether the construction waste falls within any type specified in column 3 of Schedule 2. (L.N. 165 of 2004)

Any person who without reasonable excuse fails to comply with an order, requirement, direction, instruction or signal given under subsection (2) or (4A), commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6. (L.N. 165 of 2004)

subsection.def: driving licence (駕駛執照) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Road Traffic Ordinance (Cap. 374);
electronic driving licence (電子駕駛執照) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Road Traffic Ordinance (Cap. 374). (26 of 2025 s. 16)

section.name: s5
section.heading: Offence of causing disruption or disorder

subsection.content: Any person who intentionally causes disruption or disorder to the operation of a designated waste disposal facility commits an offence and is liable to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person charged with an offence in subsection (1) has a defence if he shows that he—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has reasonably complied with all orders, requirements, directions, instructions or signals given by the Director, the facility operator and any designated officer and authorized officer by virtue of section 4; and (L.N. 165 of 2004)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has exercised all due diligence to avoid causing disruption or disorder to the operation of the designated waste disposal facility.

section.name: s5A
section.heading: Offences involving incorrect information
section.leadIn: A person who, in purported compliance with a requirement under section 4—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: makes any statement or gives any information that he knows to be incorrect in a material particular;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: recklessly makes any statement or gives any information that is incorrect in a material particular; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: knowingly or recklessly omits any material particular from any statement or information,

section.continued: commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Certificates of image recording and printing devices

subsection.leadIn: A document in such form as may be specified by the Director purporting—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be a record of the testing of the functioning, inspection or servicing of an image recording device, with or without any associated image printing device, used for the purpose of recording and, where appropriate, reproducing the images of vehicles or vessels within, entering or leaving a designated waste disposal facility, specified in the document; and (L.N. 165 of 2004)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to be certified by a person authorized in this behalf by the Director,

subsection.continued: shall be admitted in any criminal or civil proceedings before any court on its production without further proof.

subsection.leadIn: On the production of a document under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the court before which it is produced shall, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, presume—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that it was signed at the time and place specified therein by a person authorized by the Director;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that the facts stated in the document relating to the testing of the functioning, inspection or servicing of the image recording device and the associated image printing device, if any, specified in the document are true; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: that the record of the facts stated in the document was made and compiled at the time stated in the document;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the document shall be evidence of all other matters contained in the document; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the recording and print, if any, produced by using the image recording device and the associated image printing device, where appropriate, shall be evidence of all matters contained in the document.

subsection.content: Where any document is produced and admitted as evidence under subsection (1), the court may, if it thinks fit, on its own motion or on the application of any party to the proceedings, summon the person who signed the document and examine him as to the subject-matter of the document.

subsection.leadIn: A document in such form as may be specified by the Director purporting to be signed by a person duly appointed under subsection (2) and purporting to be a certificate as to the processing of exposed film received and processed by him shall, together with the photographic prints or photographic enlargements referred to in the document, be admitted in evidence in any criminal or civil proceedings before any court on its production without further proof, and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the absence of evidence to the contrary, the court before which such document is produced shall presume that the signature to the document is genuine and that the person signing it was duly appointed under subsection (2) at the time when he signed it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such document shall be evidence of all matters contained in the document.

subsection.content: The Director may appoint in writing such persons as he thinks fit to carry out the processing of exposed film and to sign certificates under subsection (1) in relation to such processing.

Where any document is produced and admitted as evidence under subsection (1), the court may, if it thinks fit, on its own motion or on the application of any party to the proceedings, summon the person who signed the document and examine him as to the subject-matter of the document.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Amendment of Schedules
section.content: The Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend any of the Schedules.
